description: Burmese are a versatile civilization that can excel in various strategies with their strong infantry and unique bonuses.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, a house, and a scout.
Lure nearby boars and sheep to gather food.
Build a house and a mill near berries.
Build a lumber camp near forests
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Build a barracks and train 3-4 militia.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional barracks and continue producing infantry units.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade infantry and sell excess resources for gold.
Research Double Bit Axe and Horse Collar.
Build a monastery and start training monks.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, and 500-600 gold at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a university and start researching ballistics and masonry.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Train Arambai, a unique unit that can deal damage from range.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 34-35 minutes with 1000 food, 800 gold, and 600 stone.
Have around 3000-3500 food, 2000-2500 wood, and 1200-1500 gold at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Research Elite Arambai for improved performance.
Build a castle to produce more Arambai.
Research Sappers to increase infantry building damage.
Use Monks to convert enemy units and Siege units to destroy buildings.
Have a mix of Arambai, champions, and halberdiers as the main army composition.
Assign villagers to resources according to the current needs of the army.
